history.p: Nielsen had barely completed the Helios overture (CNW 34) during a stay in Greece in the spring of 1903, before he began on the new piece, Søvnen. The work on the composition did not come easily to him, for six months later he had not got much further. During autumn 1903, he seems to have had a turning-point, however, and finished it in November the following year.

physLoc.identifier: Kultusministeriet, 3. Kontor, Ansøgninger om understøttelse til forfattere og kunstnere

annot.p: Typewritten and undated manuscript, presumably intended for Nielsen's autobiography
Undated manuscript with what appears to be Nielsen's own attempt at a text for 'Søvnen'.
